content.body: I'm swamped this week and can't make it. I'll send Fireflies to record and take notes; someone will have to let it into the meet.

If you want to discuss anything before Fireflies starts, it will wait for 5 minutes after asking to be let in. Message me if you need it triggered to re-join. It takes about a minute to arrive after i trigger it (so it may not be there exactly at 17:00 CESTâ€”if it doesn't show up by ~17:02, message me and I'll re-trigger it)
Thank you! I'm in the meeting now, so probably I can let it in whenever you want :)
I have a conflict first half hour. Will join late, if you are still around

content.body: I've posted a new variant of the reexports analysis in https://github.com/tc39/proposal-esm-phase-imports/issues/20#issuecomment-2305458992, it would be great to get some feedback further to work towards specifying the full analysis.

TIL minifier invariance is desired, and that makes sense. I read that as:
```
assert.deepEqual(
 new ModuleSource(       source ).exports(),
 new ModuleSource(minify(source)).exports());
```
content.formatted_body:
TIL minifier invariance is desired, and that makes sense. I read that as:

assert.deepEqual(
 new ModuleSource(       source ).exports(),
 new ModuleSource(minify(source)).exports());

content.body: Starting with the bikeshed, consider naming the determinants/types: `export/Export`, `reexport/Reexport`, `exportAll/reexportAll`.

content.body: I like that this cleanly separates the motivating use cases for `imports()` and `exports()` in general, where `bindings()` conflates those concerns.
content.formatted_body: I like that this cleanly separates the motivating use cases for imports() and exports() in general, where bindings() conflates those concerns.

content.body:
> <@kriskowal:aelf.land> Starting with the bikeshed, consider naming the determinants/types: `export/Export`, `reexport/Reexport`, `reexports/Reexports`.

Maybe `local | external | reexports`?
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @kriskowal:aelf.land
Starting with the bikeshed, consider naming the determinants/types: export/Export, reexport/Reexport, reexports/Reexports.
Maybe local | external | reexports?

content.body: That is `imports()` is sufficient for traversing the dependency graph and `exports()` is sufficient for collecting the names and their linkage up the graph.
content.formatted_body: That is imports() is sufficient for traversing the dependency graph and exports() is sufficient for collecting the names and their linkage up the graph.

content.body: I dislike local because its dual is remote and absent in the metaphor.
Hmm, or something like `internal | external | reexports`?
content.formatted_body: Hmm, or something like internal | external | reexports?

content.body: The duality of internal and external is satisfying but the incongruence of reexports is dissatisfying.
